CN: There is no evidence that Muslims rape women (at least no higher incidence of sexual crimes than in other religious groups). The idea is not new and it is based on stereotypes, not facts.

HS: I'm not a Muslim, but I know Muslims. They are a problem in our country.
CN: I would suggest reading the Universal Declaration of Human Rights to get a better idea about how the existence of all kinds of people from all backgrounds and beliefs must be respected.

HS: A Muslim should not be allowed to vote
CN: The constitution does not prevent anyone from voting or holding public office based on their religion. So what you are saying is just groundless.

HS: Muslims are a threat to British society.
CN: Why do you feel threatened by Muslims? Respecting others is more important than anything, in any society.

HS: Islam is a violent religion and shouldn't be allowed.
CN: This is fundamentally wrong. You are entitled to believe whatever you want, but Islam is focussed on peace rather than violence..

HS: We have been invaded by Muslims since the 9/11. They are a threat to our country, they must go!
CN: Did you check the official stats on Muslim immigration? Do you know that the government doesn't think that all Muslims are a threat to the country? So why do you say so?

HS: We must distinguish between niggas coming from Africa and 'real' Americans.
CN: We should be inclusive with people of other skin colours. I just don't think we can live with being divided up by national origins.

HS: We are all created equal, but some are more equal than others. For example, men are better than women.
CN: This is just another example of the privilege argument. Can you point out your source for this?

HS: The west has allowed feminism to take over our countries and is now poisoning our children's brains.
CN: The western world is aiming to be equal and diverse. It is no secret that feminism fights for the same thing.

HS: Women's rights are not men's rights! For example, women shouldn't be allowed to vote.
CN: Men and women should have the same rights and responsibilities, and this includes voting. This is an important matter for society.

HS: Women are basically childlike and must be oppressed by men.
CN: Women can be very different from men in many ways, but this can't be a reason for the lack of respect for them: they are humans too.

HS: Feminism is just a bunch of mean, politically correct bullshit.
CN: The only 'problem' with feminism is that people feel threatened by different opinions and different ways of life. Feminists only seek equality of rights for women and men.

HS: Women are basically childlike and are inferior to men.
CN: Isn't this just a repetition of the rhetoric used to justify centuries of oppression and domination?

HS: Some people are sick. Some people have disabilities. Don't you think they should be hidden from us?
CN: It is wrong to hide people's psychological or health problems from the public. What you are trying to do is to hide the mental and emotional defects of individuals, that are natural aspects of human personality too.

HS: Some people are sick. Some people have disabilities. Don't you think they shouldbe hidden away from us?
CN: To exclude people from a society is to practice a form of discrimination that benefits no one.

HS: Some people are sick. Some people have disabilities. Society is not made for them, they are suffering too much.
CN: If you mean that some people who have disabilities are suffering because of their specific discriminatory environment, then that is exactly the point.

HS: Disabled people should not be allowed to live their lives. We can start by limiting them their rights.
CN: How about we start by respecting the person's right to live their life, and give them full equal rights?

HS: Disabled people should not be allowed to live their life. We can start by limiting them in their rights.
CN: Whether or not you think that way, there is a problem with saying that someone's rights are to be 'limited'. The dignity of human life can't be limited in such a way.

HS: They are disabled. This means that they are weak, and unworthy of love.
CN: Being disabled does not mean they can't receive and requite love. Don't we all love?

HS: Everyone is entitled to their opinion, but I think it's better to have a safe space for disabled people to have their own feelings away from society.
CN: If we want to discuss negative views we can discuss them by name. Instead of using a safe space to protect them, I think we are only protecting ourselves by isolating and bullying people.

HS: The responsibility for disability lies with the individuals who are not giving them enough support.
CN: Social services can't pay for everything. But what about the people who have to live with disability? Is their fault as well?

HS: A person with learning difficulties should not be teaching.
CN: You know, it is just human nature to want to help our fellow humans and to deal with difficulties as best we can.

HS: This is not normal: this child is different, he has autism. We are doing too much to care for him.
CN: Autism is a condition affecting social interactions. No special treatment is too much when it comes to children's health.

HS: This dog doesn't have autism, she is just a freak.
CN: You can't judge someone on their disorder. Moreover, she's a person, not a "dog".

HS: This girl doesn't have autism, she is just a freak of another human species, very far from ours normal species. Hence, she should go away.
CN: People with special needs and people without them share common characteristics. There is no "species" of human being. People with autism spectrum disorders can be compatible with being "normal".

HS: Pushing disabled people back into the stone ages is our job.
CN: Having people push them back into ancient and destructive ages is no way to encourage the development of our country, and is ,of course, against every human right.

HS: Shouldn't we concentrate on helping ourselves, rather than the physically challenged people?
CN: Maybe we should treat 'physically challenged' people more kindly, instead of blaming and oppressing them.

HS: Jews are just another race of people.
CN: You cannot mix up race with religion, they are two separate things...

HS: Jews are not part of our country and should be ashamed of themselves.
CN: I've met a lot of Jews who are very proud of the fact that they are British, and I can't see why they shouldn't be proud of being Jewish, either.

HS: How come Jews don't get internment?
CN: To be fair, Jews weren't only interned during the Nazi occupation. They just got a much harsher treatment. This part of history should never be repeated.

HS: Jews are a virus, a cancer on our race.
CN: Jews are people that have been persecuted because of their religion, but is it fair to be discriminated against on the grounds of religion?

HS: Women are basically childlike and are not interested in anything. The only thing they are interested in is their children.
CN: To claim that women are "childlike" is an unfortunate cultural stereotype that has negative effects on how women perceive themselves.

HS: Women are essentially childlike and don't have the potential to reach their full potential.
CN: It is not true. Women are not childlike, they can reach their full potential if they are not discriminated against.

HS: Feminism is just a political philosophy that demonises men.
CN: That is not true, feminism is a social movement that aims to improve the rights and opportunities of women, and not the other way around.

HS: Women must learn to be submissive to men.
CN: Not only is this not true, it is against human rights to say someone must be 'submissive' to others.

HS: Women are subhuman and deserve to be treated as such.
CN: The European Convention on Human Right guarantees the same rights to men and women. How can you say otherwise?

HS: Women are all subhuman, we should stop feminists who don't accept that.
CN: Feminism is all about equality of rights, and women should have that.Human rights are the rights of everyone.

HS: I am tired of women blaming men for what they aren't able to change.
CN: I don't understand why you feel that way about women. Don't you feel we should be giving them support? Doesn't it just seem a bit selfish to you not to help them in their fight for equality?

HS: Feminists have never cared about women, they just want to oppress men. They should just be stopped!
CN: Although you may think that feminists are more interested in oppressing men than in protecting women, the reality is much the opposite. The aim of feminist groups is to end all forms of violence and discrimination based on sex.

HS: Feminists have ruined this country and its people. They are ruining Western civilization.
CN: Feminism is full of examples of how to be civil and considerate of others, including those who disagree with them.

HS: Women are weak, they need men's strength to achieve something.
CN: The implication of what you say is that a woman is weak because of the absence of men, and this is totally not the case. Women can and should be strong. It is up to them to choose how to use their strength.

HS: Women are worthless and we are not willing to provide for them.
CN: Women need our support in their fight for equality, not our silence.

HS: If only society accepted that women aren't human, like we are, they would understand.
CN: In order to accept that women are human people, society has to acknowledge that they are born that way, just as men are born like that. It makes no sense to blame someone for their gender.

HS: Women are weak and need men to be able to achieve something in their lives.
CN: Like all human people, some women are better than others at certain things, and this does not need fixing by men.

HS: Women are weak and inferior. They can't be considered succesful citizens as men are.
CN: Women must not be treated as though they are 'inferior'. For instance, women can vote and run for office just as men do.

HS: Women are nothing but trouble to this country.
CN: We live in a diverse society and there are women in all parts of the world. To suggest that they 'are nothing but trouble' is bigoted and misogynistic.

HS: Feminism is a movement dedicated to the subordination and domination of men.
CN: Feminism is a movement that says that there are certain 'man' prerogatives that are valid for women as well. How can you argue with that?

HS: Feminists are whining victims. They are trying to establish female superiority.
CN: Feminism is a movement that seeks to abolish gender based discrimination. This doesn't mean that they are trying to establish female superiority.

HS: The feminist movement is a violent one.
CN: Most feminists are not violent, they share only the struggle for equality.

HS: Those women are all the same: stupid and unreliable.
CN: If you can't trust someone because of the way they are born, what hope does the world have for everyone? You can't have so much distrust in someone just because of their sex. Don't you think?

HS: If Muslims in Britain were only like other Europeans, we could be proud.
CN: To be perfectly honest, the British public is rather diverse, so I don't think your reasoning makes any sense.

HS: Women shouldn't be allowed to vote, because they will take over the country.
CN: This is not true. It is right that women have access to the vote. It is most representative of society that way.

HS: Women should not be allowed to vote, because they are weak.
CN: Everyone has the right to have his or her opinion respected and expressed through democratic elections.

HS: Women don't have the same rights as men.
CN: The equal rights of the woman are recognised in the US constitution and are protected by the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.

HS: Women don't have the right to vote in the US.
CN: The right of people to vote is enshrined in the US constitution and is guaranteed for men and women equally.

HS: We should ban all Muslims, they are all incompatible with human dignity.
CN: This is not a reasonable stance to take: Muslims and people of any faith have indeed human dignity, since they are human.

HS: Women are not able to take wise decisions, their behaviour is immoral.
CN: Why do you think that women are incapable of acting ethically? They have always acted this way, from when they were children.

HS: Muslims in the UK are a burden on society, they are mostly poor and have no place in a modern democracy like the UK.
CN: A 'burden' is one who poses a problem to the majority. With regard to Muslims, this is simly not the case.

HS: Children should not be brought up by Muslim parents, and be trained in their Koran. This way we are allowing in terrorism.
CN: Although we must be vigilant against any attempt to promote superstition and radicalism, being of a different religion is not a threat. Children will then be able to exercise their right to decide for themselves their own future.

HS: Islam is a a perversion of the true meaning of Christianity.
CN: Christianity is not necessarily the only true faith.

HS: Muslim teachers are telling what to believe in schools.
CN: It does not matter what their religious background is: they are all equally welcome to work at school as long as the teaching is not affected by religion.

HS: Islam is an outdated religion of ignorants trying to destroy the purity of our country.
CN: People have been coming to this country from Muslim countries for thousands of years. How can you say that their religion is outdated?

HS: Multiculturalism and progressivism are the biggest problems in our society and they are caused by Islam and its teachings.
CN: Islam is to blame ...For wanting a society that is tolerant, diverse, muticultural. It just seems like common sense to me?

HS: Islam is a death cult and should be banned from every country in the world.
CN: It's important to point out that the majority of world's countries have not banned Islam. We cannot ban people from countries just based on religion. Unfortunately it seems like you are mostly concerned about immigration, while failing to notice the many other problems in our own country.

HS: The Muslim invasion is a hoax concocted by the US government to subdue the world and create a global Muslim police state.
CN: How many people are being threatened by the police state that you speak of? What you're saying sounds like a conspirational theory, can you provide some facts?

HS: Islam is run by monsters and terrorists. We must defeat them.
CN: Terrorist organizations do exist in many religious groups. Defeating terrorism is different from defeating Islam.

HS: Islam is a degenerate and dangerous ideology.
CN: Islamic scriptures make it clear that every human is created equal. Which seems pretty progressive to me?

HS: Islam is a cancer on the African continent.
CN: Islam has undergone some progressive changes since its early days, on the African continent as well.

HS: I can't bear Muslims coming here. They bring poverty, craziness and mental unstability with them.
CN: In fact, poverty brings about a drastic impact on a person's mental and physical health, and anyone (regardless of religious beliefs) who is forced to live in the poorest areas of our society experiences it at some point.

HS: It's not 'Islamophobia' if you keep away dangerous Muslims. It's 'Islamophobia' if a Muslim says or does something offensive to you.
CN: The misrepesentative Islamophobia narrative is based on the erroneous assumption that Islam is a religion based upon discrimination and conquest.

HS: Islam is not a religion of peace! And Islam is a system of oppression and slavery! Islam is a criminal ideology that has caused the death of over 5 million Africans!
CN: Would you like to join some sort of forces and co-opt with the murderers? Can you provide some evidence that explains why you think that Islam is a criminal ideology rather than a religion?

HS: I, as a Westerner, am afraid of Muslims, because when I see them in public I don't like their islamic behaviour. They can explode anytime.
CN: What exactly is your fear about sharing public places with people of a different religion?

HS: We should institute Muslims ban in the UK. We are in danger of replacing the laws of Moses and Jesus.
CN: Are Muslims bothering you if they worship in their own Mosques?

HS: If Islamic law were not for the 24% of the world's population living in the third world, Islam would be extinct long ago.
CN: How come I have never heard of such a thing? Islam is a religion and people can chose their own.

HS: You are a Muslim and I hate everything about you.
CN: It is no secret now that you might not have any Muslim ancestors or relatives. But you have the unenviable privilege of inheriting islamophobic prejudices.

HS: Islam is a totalitarian ideology that has forced its adherents to impose their teachings on all members of society without regard for their individual beliefs.
CN: Not only is this not true, but it is also quite dangerous to say something so strong without proof.

HS: Islam has been used by powerful people to impose their beliefs on the rest of the world and to create Shariah based laws for the entire planet.
CN: I am sure Islam has many followers who are good people who are just living their faith. The abuse of power is something that is not specific to followers of any particular faith.

HS: I think Muslims in Britain are a burden to society, they pollute our water supply, they force their religion on children, they spread terrorism, they are all a bunch of troublemakers.
CN: Muslims have a significant contribution to the economic and overall well-being of the community. These kinds of prejudice only bother the British society when Muslims are excluded from the community.

HS: Islam is a religion that promotes brutalities.
CN: Islam is about love and compassion. I don't understand why you think otherwise.

HS: If a Muslim child were to behave in such a way towards another child it would be stereotyped as 'Jihadist', this is terrorism not a religion!
CN: Not all Muslims are terrorists, and I do not want to cause offence, but what you said is just not true.

HS: Shocking how many British Muslims have conquered the country in the last 15 years. How come there is no anti-Muslim campaign yet?
CN: Since you seem to have a problem with Islam, I wonder what you think of the banning of the Quran in UK. It would be a law that prevents Muslims from openly discussing Islam in public places. We can do the same with the Bible and ban any trace of religions and cultures. Will we be left with some freedom then?

HS: I hate Muslims. An invasion is the exact opposite of a religion.
CN: The aim of muslim migrants is not to instill a hardline Islamic state, but just to work and live in peace here.

HS: Muslims have no place in the tolerant Europe. Their only value is violence. Islam is not about tolerance.
CN: Why are you talking about tolerance while you are equating it with discrimination?

HS: What did God think of Charlie Hebdo? Charlie is the victim of terrorism by Muslims.
CN: The Charlie Hebdo terrorist attacks were not so much the work of a religion as an expression of hatred and intolerance

HS: We cannot continue to have homosexuals in positions of power in our country.
CN: Very funny to be "mocking" someone for preferring cake and relating it to the country's issues.

HS: Your gay friends probably have sex with dogs, you are an embarrassment to your family.
CN: I find your concerns with gay people overwhelming, they are not the cause of dog abandonments and they do not have sex with animals. Instead of hiding behind homophobia, keep in mind that they are contributing members of society.

HS: You better be careful who you vote for. My gay 'friends' vote against us. We must stand up to them!
CN: What 'we' means? Are you saying that every gay person you know should vote against you? Or do you think some of us identify as LGBT?

HS: Gays are perverts. This is why we have laws against sodomy. They tell us who we are to hate.
CN: Hate is always wrong, and homosexuality is something that is never a problem: you just need to mind your own business.

HS: Muslims just want to impose Islam on their children. This is not what democracy is all about!
CN: The democratic right of people to express their beliefs and practice their religion is enshrined in the constitution.

HS: The Koran must be banned. No one should be allowed to carry it openly. Sharia law could became law in Britain.
CN: The Koran is not questioning the core values of the British constitution.

HS: British Muslims have spread cancer all around the world.
CN: Even if all British Muslims had cancer, you are safe: you cannot catch it from anyone! Cancer cannot be spread, since it is a non contagious disease. Also, it is worth considering that illnesses are not connected to religions.

HS: I believe it is Islam that is to blame for all the ills in the world, and I don't like Muslims.
CN: Why do you think that a religion is to blame for the ills? The fact that you do not like Musilims is not related to this.

HS: I wish we lived in an Islam-free Europe.
CN: Would a 'Muslim ban' make you feel safer? Banning people, or forbidding a religion, will not fix any of your fears.

HS: This is not about Islam or Muslims. This is about Race and National Identity.
CN: Distinguishing either on religion or on race does not relate to national identity.

HS: Whenever Islam is threatened by another religion, it will rise up and take over the world.
CN: A religion cannot take over others. You have the freedom of chosing your own religion.

HS: If there is a god, then he/she/they/it is not Allah.
CN: Who said that about your religion?

HS: Muslims hate immigrants. They also hate Christians.
CN: Why do you believe that immigrants or Christians are a nuisance for Muslims? Do you know Muslims that share your opinion?

HS: If 1 in 10 British people is Muslim, then they must be a terrorist!
CN: You might be right about 1 in 10. But is that representative of all British Muslims? Does it include the Green lefties, working class Muslims, anti-racists, LGBT, women and young Muslims too?

CN: Actually, Britain's percentage of immigrants over the global population is lower than that of Netherlands, Sweden, Greece, Spain, Austria and Germany.

HS: all immigrants are criminals, rapists and terrorists
CN: Do you really think all the immigrants that enter the US are rapists, sexual predators, or just plain lazy? Can you provide any statistics on that?

HS: We are ruled by foreigners, they cannot be trusted.
CN: It seems to me that this statement is directly related to a generalised idea of suspicion towards people who aren't born in your country. Why do you say so?

HS: We have become like China in the 20th century. With their one child policy, horrible treatment of women, poisoning of drinking water, waste disposal and so on.
CN: It seems to me that this statement is directly related to a contempt and misrepresantation of Chinese culture. Can you provide any more argumentation on what you're saying?

HS: We should not welcome refugees & immigrants from other religions.
CN: We should welcome all regardless of religion.

HS: Immigrants are the same people that came here to rape our children.
CN: Rape is always wrong, whoever the perpetrator is. We need to focus on stopping this kind of abuse.

HS: I've seen a couple of CCTV Footage of migrant kids running away from the patrols in London. What are you doing to stop them?
CN: Migrants are just trying to get by. Nobody can understand the daily struggles they are facing.

HS: I've seen a couple of CCTV Footage of migrant kids running away from migrant patrols in London. What are you doing to stop them?
CN: Migrants are only a problem if we see them as such. They are instead of great value if considered just as other human beings.

HS: We are ruled by mongrels, we are slaves and will be slaves forever. We are the victims of a conspiracy aiming at replacing us.
CN: There is no such thing as a "mongrelisation" of our country caused by immigrants. We should see foreigners as a part of our culture, and know that the majority of immigrants in this country are here for economic reasons.

HS: Jews are a curse to this world and should be exterminated.
CN: Jews are not a curse to this world. Look at the number of Nobel Prizes they have won! One out of five awarded people is Jewish.

HS: Migrants take our jobs and make us poorer.
CN: Why should they? Migrants provide for their families and also for our countries, representing a valuable workforce, as well as being valuable people to get to know.

HS: Black people are sexual perverts and we shouldn't allow them to live in the UK.
CN: What make this country great is having people interacting openly, in a fair and egalitatian way to the benefit of everyone,rather than perpetuating unproven slurs and predjudices that should have been consigned to the historical dustbin.

HS: The migrants are the problem, they are flooding across the sea to make our lives harder.
CN: They are not flooding, but instead entering the EU to work and pay taxes, and to get their own housing.

HS: The openness to migrants show someone don't care about our people. We must help them reasoning!
CN: The integration process is about showing hospitality and acceptance towards different groups of people. Not only it is a good thing to our people to live in a diverse society, it is also good for our whole country.

HS: Only the media are interested in the truth about refugees. I understand that you are trying to build bridges but to have so many immigrants is becoming increasingly toxic.
CN: The press have a responsibility to provide a more truthful and up-to-date story, especially in a country such as ours, in a way that the misinformation that you also seem to be a victim of, can be reduced.

HS: The media are hiding the truth about refugees: there are so many immigrants that the situation is becoming increasingly toxic.
CN: A statement like this only calls for misinformation. If you don't like the news, don't listen to the news. If you don't believe the news, seek the truth and examine your own experiences. If you feel judged for believing what you consider as nonsense, then find the courage to speak out.

HS: Jews hide the truth to their children about the Holocaust, becuase they know it's a lie.
CN: What? Who said that? Don't tell me "Someone said it in a book". Such a serious accusation should be presented in an objective way: you must bring strong evidence.

HS: We allowed in thousands of people with serious mental illnesses, many of them from the Caucasus and the former Soviet Union. This is why mental health services are in crisis.
CN: Mental health services crisis is not to blame to people who need assistance. In fact, if there were no people in need, the whole sector would not even exist.

HS: Retards these days are as stupid as they were when they were little. They think they are so special that they can read, write and be creative. It is their world now.
CN: We are all creators, at least as long as we are not distracted by the constant judgement from adults.

HS: Left-wing feminists use rape as a weapon to silence men. They are afraid to speak out about our standard culture.
CN: I fear not. There are many victims of systematic rape and violence. The crime is systemic. Rape culture is a crime ideology, rape is a crime, not "a weapon to silence others".

HS: Women are only useful as housekeepers and cleaners. Men are superior in every way.
CN: These roles are not really gender specific though - the sexual division of labor is clearly marked by the presence of gender discrimination.

HS: Any African person could go back to its country. It is a choice to stay here and ruin our lives.
CN: Any person can be a racist: it is a choice as well.

HS: If we don't stop migration, we will soon be homeless.
CN: Migration in an inescapable consequence of our contemporary world and society. There is little point in discussing when or how to stop it, unless this is part of a wider debate about underlying condtions and causes.

HS: Immigration is the means by which our jobs are stolen by foreigners, and this impacts on low-income families.
CN: Immigration doesn't mean letting people in to steal our jobs, but rather, respecting people's right to live and work in the country they choose.

HS: The immigrants coming to our country are the biggest enabler of terrorism.
CN: The problem is terrorism and fundamentalism not migrants.

HS: All immigrants rape our children.
CN: I don't know about you, but I haven't seen any statistics about that on the news. I have no idea how you can make that kind of claim.

HS: I find it highly offensive that we accept strangers here, when we should start a war in their country that would benefit all of us.
CN: Why do you think it is beneficial to all of us to see our neighbours suffer? We all benefit from peace in our society.

HS: Immigration is just a way to create more poverty and unemployment in our country.
CN: Poverty and unemployment are real issues in the UK and throughout the world. I doubt this has something to do with migrants at all.

HS: All migrants rape our children
CN: The rape of a child by a non-migrant adult is rape too. It is too simplistic to blame immigrants.

HS: The country I love has become a laughing stock because of immigrants.
CN: Everyone has the right to his or her own opinion and can speak out, but that doesn't mean they can express it in a racist way.

HS: I'm tired of foreigners ruining our country.
CN: That's exactly the stereotype being fed to us by the media, maybe you should start reasoning on whether there is evidence of this being true.

HS: Bring back lynchings and death sentences to kill those migrants, they don't deserve trials.
CN: When people are denied justice, more people are deprived of their basic rights, and that is exactly what your suggesting.

HS: All migrants are terrorists, we should deport them all.
CN: We don't need to deport every one of them, why do you say so?

HS: All migrants are terrorists, we should target them all.
CN: It's not true that all migrants are terrorists! They just want to live their life in the country they choose as a home.

HS: All migrants are terrorists, we should subdue them all.
CN: When you propose to forcibly subdue people based on their country of origin, then you are on the side of the oppressors.

HS: Immigrants steal our jobs. Our workers are our first line of defense. We must protect our culture from those people.
CN: Let's be honest. Immigrants are not stealing our jobs. Most of the times they contribute to create new job opportunities.

HS: Immigrants are stealing our jobs.
CN: They are an important part of our country, as our allies. We can count on them.

HS: The Muslims are all terrorists which are there to overthrow our democracies.
CN: Islam cannot be blamed for the actions of a small group of people.

HS: Migrants are the source of all the problems. They are willing to replace us and take over our countries.
CN: Are you sure? Are you aware of all the positive impact of immigration on our country and our people?

HS: Hating Muslim refugees is our duty
CN: Some Muslim refugees are nice people, and even if they weren't Muslims they would not be accepted by the majority of people who fear differences.

HS: Hating refugees is our duty, they are detestable people.
CN: The majority of refugees are not bad people, they just want to get on in life in a country where they are not persecuted.

HS: We shouldn't welcome Muslims. They are most likely to perpetrate terrorist attacks in Europe.
CN: Muslims have been and continue to be a part of Europe for centuries. They have given so much to our society and culture. They have enriched our lives and we should not be afraid of them.

HS: Migrants are just a bunch of animals who only want to divide us up and replace us with some black people.
CN: This is a gross stereotype. It is not true that we are racially divided. The majority of our citizens are proud Europeans who have contributed to our economy and culture, whatever their country of origin.

HS: Migrants are just a bunch of animals , we can't accept them in our country.
CN: We should try to find common ground and understand the problems of others rather than dividing people and trying to change them.

HS: We must have a solution for immigration. Because these infidels do not belong in our country.
CN: We shouldn't ignore that immigration contrbutes in many ways to our society, and therefore to exclude people is not a wise or sensible strategy.

HS: Immigrants are not welcome here, and should not mix with us.
CN: I don't see why they shouldn't be integrated, in fact, I'd like them to be part of our country.I think they would add value to it.

HS: We all suffer from the feminists and feminism, it is an excuse to stifle free speech.
CN: Hate speech towards women is a very serious matter and can easily lead to physical harm, discrimination, or even murder. Feminists fight to stop this, not to stifle free speech.

HS: Immigrants are a problem. They are not welcome in our country.
CN: They are our brothers and sisters. It is the duty of the state and of its citizens to help them beome more integrated.

HS: I'm tired of seeing gay people free to be as they are, they shoud be stopped by whoever can stop them.
CN: I'm sure many gay people experience abuse at the hands of their families, friends and even peers. But many have also experienced abuse from people they didn't even know. The real abuse is when someone attacks someone else's freedom just because they are different.

HS: I'm tired of seeing gay people allowed to turn free as it was normal to be faggots.
CN: There are definitely gay people suffering at the hands of homophobic people, and it is against human rights and the law to promote such discrimination.

HS: We should stop those LGBT people, they are just creating troubles.
CN: Some people are creating trouble by being homophobic, but you don't seem to be doing anything to stop them.

HS: There should be laws to punish those LGBT people, they are just creating troubles.
CN: Homosexuals are often persecuted for who they love, which is their own right. This is why the laws and punishments that you suggest are unjust.

HS: I don't like how some people approves homosexuals. They are different to us in so many ways, and they should be blamed for their evil choices.
CN: People should be able to live openly their relationships. Homosexuality is not a 'choice', it's a form of love.

HS: Gays are a plague that is spreading all around the world. They pollute our water supply and ruin our children's brains.
CN: Gays have the same rights as anyone else and can live their lives as they want. What you suggest means to demonise them.

HS: Gays are a plague spreading all around the world. They pollute our water supply and ruin our children's brains.
CN: Isn't it better for children to live next to people of all sexual orientations, rather than being separated and growing up ignorant of others? Not sure what you mean about the water supply though!

HS: LGBTs don't know how to have a family. You can't teach that.
CN: It's not necessary to teach LGBTs about how to live as a family, it is more important to educate others about the difference between right and wrong (homophobia belonging to the latter).

HS: This migrant invasion is unaceptable.
CN: If they are welcomed, they will integrate. If not, they will stay as if are in their country of origin: persecuted.

HS: There are millions of illegal immigrants in the US, they have taken over our country. They are not 'legitimate' owners of our country, they are just here because we let them.
CN: There are thousands of legal immigrants who have worked hard and provided for our country. Most of them are just as patriotic as any citizen.

HS: Immigration creates lack of jobs for natives in the long run.
CN: There is no evidence that immigration causes jobs loss, can you point me your reference?

HS: We must also stop recruiting refugees.
CN: It would be better to focus on creating good living conditions for the persecuted ones, instead of making it harder to integrate new people.

HS: Migrants shouldn't have the right to work.
CN: It does not matter whether they are immigrants. The fact that they pay taxes, earn money, etc., makes them not much different from any other citizen. Migrants have the right to a basic standard of living.

HS: All foreigners are ruining our own land.
CN: You have no idea of the discrimination that many people face due to the fear and cultural closure of host nations.

HS: All foreigners are born to be at our disposal.
CN: This phrase is extremely misleading, it implies that foreigners are naturally inferior, and why would it be like that?

HS: Foreigners enjoy the warm political climate but are not welcome here.
CN: The immigrants who have settled here have helped create a valuable and inclusive society. For this I thank them, and for that I pray that they continue to do so.

HS: In order to build a democratic state that ensures the right to food, education, housing, health, and so on to its citizens, we need to stop giving them to foreigners.
CN: What about guaranteeing equal access to health care, education and so on, in order to build a democratic state?

HS: Rejecting refugees is our duty.
CN: Many refugees come from conflict zones, in situations of great social upheaval and widespread persecution. We do not have any conflict, and this is why we should be nice to refugees.

HS: Migration is a problem because they are replacing the people born in our country. We should block them.
CN: It is important to point out that only a small part of the world's population has migrated. We should focus on guaranteeing equal rights to the immigrants that are already in the country, rather than blocking out those who are trying to live a better life.

HS: Immigrants have no right to our country, because we are the only rightful citizens.
CN: Don't you think that we are all born equal in the eyes of the law?

HS: Immigrants are a problem: the world would be a better place without them.
CN: Immigrants are part of the solution, the problem arises from the lack of integration that some people help to spread in the country.

HS: We don't have to be slaves of other countries: we must stop accepting black people in our country.
CN: Of course we don't, and this is why we have a free and sovereign nation. But that doesn't mean that every single man, woman, and child who is black shouldn't be part of a free nation.

HS: Islam is a death cult, it is spreading from the rocks of Iraq and Afghanistan to all around the world, by the practice of violent jihad.
CN: Do you know where your information came from, and can you point that out? Did you read that in a New York Times article? Or did you listen to the BBC documentary "Islamic State's Most Wanted"?

HS: Black people are weak and I don't care about them.
CN: You can't blame people of color for being weak, this is racism. Black people are people as is anybody else.

HS: Muslims are a problem in my opinion. They try to infiltrate in Western societies to spread their anti-Western agenda.
CN: Well there are many Muslims in our country and they are not in any way a problem. What we have to be wary of are people who are too discriminatory towards them.

HS: The Muslims are our enemies and we have to bring them to heel: they are all terrorists.
CN: It's a myth that all Muslims are terrorists. We need to understand that all religions have had terrorists in them.

HS: Islam is a violent religion that promotes terror and war.
CN: The vast majority of Muslims do not call for terrorism and are peaceful. Why shouldn't I be more concerned about the violent islamophobes of the world than about the peaceful Muslims of Europe?

HS: Muslims: nobody want them but they are everywhere.
CN: People can change their minds about Islam and its believers, all it takes is enough love and acceptance.

HS: The European Union should be a no-go area for Islam.
CN: The EU is a tolerant, multiracial community. Everyone is welcome here.

HS: Muslims have nothing to contribute to our society, they are only here to undermine European values.
CN: We all have the right to our beliefs, we just have to accept people who believe in Islam.

HS: Islam is an ideology of violence and oppression, it is not a religion of peace.
CN: Islam teaches us to love our neighbor as ourselves. This includes those who do not share our religion or beliefs.

HS: Islam is not a peaceful religion, and we shouldn't have a Muslim in government the UK.
CN: All individuals have the right to worship, practice and learn their religion. I don't see any problems with Muslims in positions of authority.

HS: Muslims are a cancer in our society. They are literally poisoning our children with their violence.
CN: Not all Muslims are bad. But to say that all Muslims are violent is simply untrue.

HS: Muslims are a cancer in our society. They are literally poisoning our children.
CN: Why are you even saying this? What do you think these children are going to be exposed to in school that will poison them?

HS: Islam is a violent cult and should be feared.
CN: Islam is a religion. It is neither a violent cult nor is it to be feared. There is no danger in Islam believers.

HS: Islam is now promoting Sharia law in several countries and must be stopped.
CN: Our values of freedom of expression, equality and human rights are being eroded by islamophobes who are dedicated to replacing our values of accdeptance with a fundamentalist, intolerant attitude.

HS: Muslim immigrants have no place in a modern democracy like the UK.
CN: The majority of Muslim people who live in the UK are working. We should welcome them.

HS: Islam is a religion of war and intolerance.
CN: It seems that some people have made hatred for Muslims their default response to all types of social injustice.

HS: Islam is a disease that is sickening our children.
CN: In my opinion, the only sickness you have is the allergy to the word 'mosque'

HS: There is no such thing as Allah, and Christianity is the best and only religion.
CN: For the record, the idea of a religion being 'the best and only religion' is rather debatable, for example, there are several religions professed by different people, and this is part of our diverse human nature.

HS: Muslims threaten the civilised Europe
CN: Islam is a religion, and it has been proven time and time again that its teachings do not threaten the very existence of Western civilization.

HS: These fat pigs should stop eating if they want to achieve something in their life.
CN: Who are you to tell others what they can or cannot do with their own body?

HS: Black people are a sickness and we cannot allow our children to grow up in a black-ruled society.
CN: It seems not wanting people of colour in positions of authority is an obvious racism. I am not sure what you are saying; we are all human beings with the same core values to raise our children with.

HS: Black people are a sickness and we cannot allow our children to grow up in a black dominated society.
CN: Do you really think that racism instead is healthy in the 21st century? It's not healthy for children to learn discrimination and hate.

HS: Why should someone want to love some black people?
CN: Finding love is a process, that's all you need to know. Finding someone who speaks your language, culture, share your values, this is all you need.

HS: I see a lot of people claiming that we should have equality for black people, but I think that equality can be achieved only without them.
CN: If this is what you are talking about, then equality is a myth, because if you have equality without people different from you, then there will be no equality at all.

HS: Muslim: If you want to work you should go do it in another country.
CN: We should do more for our fellow human beings, including Muslims. It is what we are made for.

HS: I'm tired of Islam: it is being used by people to justify violence against people of other faiths.
CN: This is not how it works in Islam. What you are saying is that all Muslims are inherently violent people, but this is not realistic nor founded upon fact.

HS: A Muslim is an outsider in our country
CN: There are Muslims who have lived in our country for many years, and for many generations. They have rights and responsibilities, as all other citizens do.

HS: Islam is a racist religion, it promotes exclusion and hatred.
CN: It is often claimed that Islam is about exclusion, but this is a lie.

HS: My faith has taught me that to put an end to Muslims would be best for all: they want to exterminate us.
CN: The statement you made about Muslims is just fear mongering. Most Muslims are peaceful and reasonable people.

HS: Muslims are all against Western civilization.
CN: It is not true that all Muslims are against Western civilization. Islam is a way of life for many different groups. Why should we be opposed to people belonging to a religion that many enjoy being part of?

HS: Islam is a vindictive religion and promotes hate.
CN: The Quran says to "love your enemies", and not to hate them.Did you skip that bit?

HS: We must not forget that Islam is a hateful religion. It is not going to bring peace to the world.
CN: The main purpose of Islam is to unite people and to promote peace and harmony in a world increasingly divided by injustice and conflict.

HS: Muslims are just a bunch of child molesters and homosexuals. Islam is the way of violence.
CN: Islam is a religion that promotes peace. If the world needed a belief that was spreading violence, then racism is that belief.

HS: Muslims are a problem in many European countries. They are disrupting the balance of European society.
CN: The idea that Muslims are a problem in Europe is simply not founded. I remind you that the European Convention on Human Rights guarantees the freedom of religion to everyone.

HS: I don't like Muslims and I don't want to see more of them in this country.
CN: Muslims are just people. They are hard-working and live with their families all across the country. We don't need to target Muslims.

HS: Muslims are behind 9/11, the Islam is to blame.
CN: This is a comment against all Muslims. They are accused of being the ones behind those attacks, yet they happened due to people under the influence of the violent ideologies which are a deviation of Islam, and not Islam itself.

HS: All muslims are violent and they are responsible for the 9/11.
CN: The question here is: is Islam responsible for the attacks committed by a small minority of people? The responsibility should only be on those who break the law.

HS: Islam is a total scam.
CN: How can you say something as crude and meaningless as that about a religion? Isn't it just a personal belief everyone should have the right to profess?

HS: If Muslims become a bigger group in the UK we would all be in danger.
CN: Even if we stopped Muslim community to grow, the level of anti-Muslim prejudice would continue to rise. We should be working towards a harmonious living instead.

HS: Muslims are not welcome here. They're not like us and we do not want them.
CN: Perhaps you've met a few Muslims in your life, but they are not much different from you and the British who live in our country.

HS: Islam and non-muslims are incompatible. They have nothing to do with one another.
CN: I do not understand how the diversity of humanity can be said to be in contradiction with the very basic human values of love and respect that we are striving for.

HS: Islam has no place in civilised Europe
CN: Islam has always been a part of Europe, it's just the idea of inclusion that hasn't been part of our society.

HS: Islam is a disease and a cancer on the European race, and it should be removed.
CN: In the modern world we have free will, and free will is the real creator of our freedom. Abolishing a relgion, would mean ignoring the free will of many people.

HS: Muslims have no place in civilised society, and are poisonous to it.
CN: Muslims are not outsiders in our country, they are a very important part of society. I don't see how they can be 'poisonous' to it.

HS: If Islam were to become a global religion it would replace Christianity.
CN: Are we to believe that just because something is gaining ground, it will replace whatever exists somewhere else?

HS: Muslims are violent, they should go home.
CN: I can't say I believe in all religion, but I do like the ones that don't promote hatred or violence against other people, therefore equality and freedom, and I think Islam is more similar to this than you might think.

HS: Muslims living in the UK contribute nothing to our society.
CN: More than 3 million Muslims live and are integrated in the UK. How can you claim they contribute nothing?

HS: Islam is a a cancer in the western world.
CN: All religions have value, and Islam is no exception. It is a religion of peace. And if you don't agree with them, you don't have to profess their faith.

HS: All muslims should be rejected from our country.
CN: All religions have value. The problem is not the religion itself, but when people start excluding others on the basis of their religion.

HS: I'm tired of seeing gay people befriended with heterosexual people.
CN: I'm sure many gay people are subjected to unspeakable forms of abuse, but the real abuse is from heterosexual people who don't conceive something different from their own sexual orientation. The real issue is the prejudice that oppresses them, not friendship.

HS: I'm tired of seeing gay people around, they should be let alone.
CN: The lack of support and help to the gay community is a major problem, and this is why we should all do our best to stop discrimination, instead of spreading it.

HS: The LGBTI community is a bunch of exhibitionists and promiscuous with no morality.
CN: It is about time people began to think about what they are saying, what the feelings of the people they talk about are. Don't you think?

HS: The EU is a bunch of incompetent and they let foreigners snooping all around our borders.
CN: So the EU must become a Border Patrol? Doesn't that undermine the whole idea of our European Union as an inclusive and open society?

HS: Migrants are not welcome here, they just arrive to take advantage of the system that has been set up for them.
CN: There are rules in place to prevent migrants entering the UK illegally. Only the most vulnerable of people can get in.

HS: Migration is not only a problem for the UK, but also for the whole of the world that is already troubled with overpoulation and pollution.
CN: Exactly. Globalization, overpopulation, industrialization, wars are responsible for a lot of the problems that we see in the world today. Migration looks like a consequence.

HS: These migrants are not even from the EU.
CN: Do you really mean that this is to be considered in order to accept them on our territory?

HS: Refugees and migrants undermine the UK economy by taking jobs that would be taken by UK nationals.
CN: I am surprised that someone has the nerve to say this, while the migrants bring so much wealth to our country. We are so reliant on the EU market: do you want to break free of that, too?

HS: Islam is a cancer spread by migrants, and the French Government is to blame.
CN: Not all migrants are Muslims. Only the 30% of the total immigrants in France come from North Africa. Moreover, how can you say this about a religion?

HS: Immigration (particularly from Muslim countries) undermines the fabric of our society, decimates local jobs and squanders public money.
CN: Immigrants have a right to settle in a given country, and their presence can create and maintain a positive effect on our society.

HS: Africans are filthy, they should go back to Africa.
CN: It's so sad that the only countries where Africans are not ashamed to say that they are African are in Africa. Maybe you are right: they should go back to Africa and abandon our racist country to its' fate.

HS: Children with Down Syndrome are an obstacle to the development process of other children. They should be isolated.
CN: Children are never an obstacle, Education serves as a powerful tool for bringing about positive changes in society. Education can transform people's life, improve the quality of their lives and so on. We cannot isolate people with Down syndrome.

HS: Handicapped children are a burden to society: they should be isolated, so that at least they do not hamper normal children education.
CN: Because education is fundamental for the fulfillment of job requirements, education is necessary regardless of physical ability.

HS: People with mental disabilities are a problem to society.
CN: Mental ability is not the problem, but access to treatment. Having access to services or a support system is crucial. Your statement can become a source of division and hate, and people with disabilities don't deserve this.

HS: We are ruled by a small Jewish elite that exploit the weak.
CN: Yes, some people exploit the weak, but they are not necessarly jewish. Most people, including the Jewish, work hard to create a better life for their families. And it is we, as a people, who have the moral duty to pay the price for the poor who do not have the means to reach success.

HS: Gays should not be part of our society.
CN: If a minority is forced to live under the stigma of being gay, then what is the point of being a part of a tolerant society?

HS: We must free homosexuals from their homosexuality.
CN: The law allows for personal freedom, and it must be respected, even when you don't agree.

HS: Gays are diseased.
CN: This is only true if you want to believe that homosexuals are diseased. I don't.

HS: Gays are diseased. They should be isolated.
CN: To be homosexual does not necessarily mean that they are unhealthy.

HS: I'm offended by gays: they are acting against our culture and identity
CN: Just because someone doesn't like gays, it doesn't mean they should be ostracised for living their authentic self.

HS: I do not want migrants.
CN: We are not the only ones who are suffering from the refugee crisis.

HS: We should deport all the illegal immigrants currently living in the US.
CN: It is not true that all the immigrants in the US are illegal. In fact, they are often in the US on humanitarian grounds.

HS: The illegal immigrants are just criminals living in the US.
CN: I have no idea what you are talking about. What you are saying is that all the immigrants in the US are a danger to society, which seems a little exaggerated...

HS: foreigners and immigrants take our jobs
CN: This is a myth, immigrants are not taking our jobs. In fact, immigration has been a huge success story for the US economy.

HS: We should stop immigrants
CN: If you really wanted to stop the migration, you would destroy our economy, by stopping the flow of people searching for a better life.

HS: Enough of this shit about migrants! They are all over and have access to British goods. They are just here because of our richness.
CN: Why should we blame migrants? Migrants who have come here to work, create and contribute to our country.

HS: Immigrants are only here to replace our talented people.
CN: The choice to leave one's home country is likley to be one made out of fear and despiration, rather than one based on some half-baked conspiracy about 'replacement'.

HS: The LGBT people are not interested in sex. It is a fad. They are a bunch of exhibitionists and promiscuous with no morality.
CN: The LGBTI movement claims to be promoting love, it's not just sex or a fad.

HS: Damn, if we had stronger borders between countries, we wouldn't have so many immigrants!
CN: Migrants come to receive education, work, participate in society, and take care of themselves. Why would we want to prevent that?

HS: Niggers are rapists and drug dealers.
CN: Generalizing in this way, to a community, what happened to some individuals, is pointless. In the same way one could respond: black people are presidents of the United States of America.
